page.title: 17Trade
page.content: Hemingbrough village has a unique ice -cream factory. The name{"Doubtfires {ice-cream"}has been known throughout the area for many years. In 1864 a hand cart was used to go around with ice-cream.The present ice-cream factory is situated in Water Lane.The ice-cream is made from a special secret recipe handed down by the owner.Vans sell ice-cream in Selby, Goole and local villages. In Cliffe village there is a small firm with the busiest office for miles around. It is{Blackwell Grain which trades on the world markets buying and selling grain. Other trade includes an agricultural repair business which has developed from a former blacksmith's shop, a plant-hire concern and a wide range of service trades:- joiners, builders, plumbers, hairdressers, etc.
